description: From Canadian French, from an alteration of travail (etymology 2), from Medieval Latin trepalium (“instrument of torture”), probably a calque from Ancient Greek. See πάσσαλος (pássalos, “peg”).

entries.meaning: A historical frame structure that was used by indigenous peoples, notably the Plains Aboriginals of North America, to drag loads over land, pulled by person, dog, or horse.
examples: On the plains they will have horses dragging travoises, dogs with travoises, women and children loaded with impedimenta.
